meanings.definition: To propel or cast in any way
meanings.sent1: She throws the ball to her friend.
meanings.sent2: He throws the paper airplane across the room.
meanings.sent3: The monkey throws the banana peel on the ground and slips on it.
meanings.sent4: The sun throws its warm rays over the field.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind throws the leaves in all directions.

meanings.definition: To put in a particular position or condition
meanings.sent1: He throws his backpack on the chair.
meanings.sent2: She throws the blanket over the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent3: The chef throws a pinch of salt into the boiling pot.
meanings.sent4: The artist throws colors onto the canvas with a brush.
meanings.sent5: The gardener throws seeds into the freshly tilled soil.

meanings.definition: To cause to fall or come in contact
meanings.sent1: The strong wind throws the leaves off the tree.
meanings.sent2: She throws the ball and it hits the target.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat throws the vase off the table.
meanings.sent4: The storm throws raindrops against the window.
meanings.sent5: The careless child throws the toy and it breaks.

meanings.sent1: He throws a shadow on the wall under the bright light.
meanings.sent2: She throws her voice to make it sound like it's coming from another room.
meanings.sent3: The magician throws a coin into the air and makes it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The actor throws his voice to mimic different characters.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller throws her words into the audience's imagination.

meanings.definition: To move or put in a specified way
meanings.sent1: She throws her hair into a messy bun.
meanings.sent2: He throws the dice onto the game board.
meanings.sent3: The dancer throws her arms up in the air during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The chef throws the ingredients into the mixing bowl.
meanings.sent5: The athlete throws the shot put with great strength.
